questionText: Question 1: It is considered to be the most interesting optical instrument because it enables us to see our surroundings in a detailed and colorful manner.

answerOptions.answerText: A refractor of light and protects the eyes from accidents by preventing foreign particles inside it.
A messenger of sensation from the eyes to the brain
The center of the eye that lets the light in and focus it on the retina.
A controller of the amount of light entering the eye.

questionText: Question 3: It refers to the nerve cells at the back of the eye essential for detecting and deciphering colors.
Question 4: The lens functions to make sure that all the light from an object is being focused on the retina only.
Question 5: It is a muscle that controls the movement of the lens.
Question 6: Which of the following best describes accommodation

answerOptions.answerText: The distance is called the minimum distance of an object from the eye.
It is the ability of the lens of the eye to adjust its focal length.
Process of visual nerve impulses that begins with interconnections in the retina and continues in the brain.
It is the method of correcting visual defects.

questionText: Question 7: Refractive Errors refer to the type of vision problems wherein the person experiences blurry visions due to the inability of the eye to focus images sharply on the retina.
Question 8: What are the two most known refractive errors?
Question 9: How are refractive errors be corrected?
